oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effects of direct drilling on Fusarium DNA levels
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Yli-Mattila, Tapani
Lahtinen, Taina
Rämö, Sari
Hietaniemi, Veli
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We have found a highly significant correlation between Fusarium graminearum DNA and deoxynivalenol (DON) levels in Finnish oats, barle and spring wheat. Fusarium poae DNA levels were higher in plots with tillage (including ploughing) as compared to those without tillage (direct drilling) in 2005 and 2006 in both oats and barley; the difference was greater a few weeks before harvesting than during it.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Yli-Mattila, Tapani; Lahtinen, Taina; Rämö, Sari and Hietaniemi, Veli (2008) Effects of direct drilling on Fusarium DNA levels. In: NJF Report, Nordic Association of Agricultural Scientists, 4 (3), p. 13.
